document.masterDocTitle: A new species and new records of palicoid crabs (Crustacea, Decapoda, Brachyura, Palicoidea, Palicidae, Crossotonotidae) from the Indo-West Pacific region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species and new records of palicoid crabs (Crustacea, Decapoda, Brachyura, Palicoidea, Palicidae, Crossotonotidae) from the Indo-West Pacific region

mods:name.mods:affiliation: California State Polytechnic University, Biological Sciences Department, Pomona, California 91768 (USA) pcastro @ csupomona. edu

Vanuatu .
SANTO 2006, stn DB63, southeast Aésé I., 15°26.9’S , 167°15.8’E , 21 m , 25.IX.2006 , 1 pre-adult ♀ (photographed) ( MNHN-B 31964). — Stn LM19, east Malo I., 15°38.5’S , 167°15.1’E , intertidal, 5.X.2006 , 1 preadult ♀ (photographed) ( MNHN-B 31965). — Stn EP36, Aoré I., Aimbué Bay, 15°33.1/33.3’S, 167°12.4/12.7’E, tangle net, 20-60 m , 15.X.2006 , 1 ovig. ♀ (photographed) ( MNHN-B 32311).

DISTRIBUTION. — Wide Indo-West Pacific distribution from the Red Sea and the western Indian Ocean to the Hawaiian Islands and Samoa ( type locality: Ambon , Indonesia ) ( Castro 2000 : table 6, fig. 51) and now the Philippines and Vanuatu . Depth: intertidal to 146 m ( Castro 2000 : table 5).
